query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
1 Poi che la carità del natio loco 2 mi strinse, raunai le fronde sparte 3 e rende’le a colui, ch’era già fioco.
query.result:
**English:**
1 After the love of my native place 2 gripped me, I gathered the scattered branches 3 and returned them to him who was already weak.
**Cornish:**
1 Wosa karita an cita genys 2 a wrug owth strivya an fronjow sparth 3 ha'gas owth dhe'n, o oas owth fiok.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
4 Indi venimmo al fine ove si parte 5 lo secondo giron dal terzo, e dove 6 si vede di giustizia orribil arte.
query.result:
**English:**
4 Then we came to the end where the 5 second circle departs from the third, and where 6 one sees the horrible art of justice.
**Cornish:**
4 Wosa henna ny vynnas dhe'n fin orth le mayth 5 an nessa giron a-dhia an tres, ha le mayth 6 y hwel gwelys an arta orth justys orthribil.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
7 A ben manifestar le cose nove, 8 dico che arrivammo ad una landa 9 che dal suo letto ogne pianta rimove.
query.result:
**English:**
7 To clearly show the new things, 8 I say that we arrived at a plain 9 that removes every plant from its bed.
**Cornish:**
7 Rag kler dhiskwedhes an traow nowyth, 8 y lavaraf ny vynnas dhe'n tir 9 a remov pub planys a'y gwely.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
10 La dolorosa selva l’è ghirlanda 11 intorno, come ’l fosso tristo ad essa; 12 quivi fermammo i passi a randa a randa.
query.result:
**English:**
10 The sorrowful forest is a garland 11 around it, as is the sad moat to it; 12 there we stopped our steps, side by side.
**Cornish:**
10 An wals orth dolorus yw an ghirlanda 11 a-dro dhe'n, kepar ha'n fos orth trist dhe'n; 12 le mayth ny sevas ni'n passys a-ronda a-ronda.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
13 Lo spazzo era una rena arida e spessa, 14 non d’altra foggia fatta che colei 15 che fu da’ piè di Caton già soppressa.
query.result:
**English:**
13 The ground was a dry and thick sand, 14 made in no other way than that 15 which was once trampled underfoot by Cato.
**Cornish:**
13 An spas o oas rena sych ha tewl, 14 heb formyans erel nebmes orth henna 15 a veu gwaskys gans traesow Katen.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
16 O vendetta di Dio, quanto tu dei 17 esser temuta da ciascun che legge 18 ciò che fu manifesto a li occhi mei!
19 D’anime nude vidi molte gregge 20 che piangean tutte assai miseramente, 21 e parea posta lor diversa legge.
query.result:
**English:**
16 O vengeance of God, how much you ought to be 17 feared by everyone who reads 18 what was revealed to my eyes!
19 I saw many herds of naked souls 20 who were all weeping very miserably, 21 and it seemed that different laws had been set for them.
**Cornish:**
16 O venjans orth Duw, pyth eus owth dhe'vys 17 bos dhe'dh ofn gans pubonan a wra'gas lejy 18 henna a veu kler dhe'm lyga'sow!
19 A welas bagas a enewegow noeth 20 a oas owth gul owth pubonan orth orth miserabel, 21 ha'gas owth semlas lejy erel dhe'n.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
22 Supin giacea in terra alcuna gente, 23 alcuna si sedea tutta raccolta, 24 e altra andava continüamente.
query.result:
**English:**
22 Some people were lying supine on the ground, 23 some were sitting all huddled up, 24 and others were walking continuously.
**Cornish:**
22 Supin o oas koweth orth an tir nebes dus, 23 nebes erel owth sedea pubonan orth kollet, 24 ha erel owth koesas orth orth kontinuys.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
25 Quella che giva ’ntorno era più molta, 26 e quella men che giacëa al tormento, 27 ma più al duolo avea la lingua sciolta.
query.result:
**English:**
25 She who went around was more numerous, 26 and she who lay in torment was less, 27 but she had her tongue more loosened to grief.
**Cornish:**
25 Hi a wra dheuth ogas oos moy, 26 ha hi a wra le ages yn an poen, 27 mes moy oos hi a wra dheuth dhe goel.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
28 Sovra tutto ’l sabbion, d’un cader lento, 29 piovean di foco dilatate falde, 30 come di neve in alpe sanza vento.
query.result:
**English:**
28 Over all the sand, with a slow fall, 29 dilated flakes of fire were raining down, 30 like snow in the Alps without wind.
**Cornish:**
28 A-ugh an chi fowt, gans kodha lent, 29 oos faljyon tan ow tewlel aga, 30 kepar ergh yn Alpen heb gwyns.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
31 Quali Alessandro in quelle parti calde 32 d’Indïa vide sopra ’l süo stuolo 33 fiamme cadere infino a terra salde,
34 per ch’ei provide a scalpitar lo suolo 35 con le sue schiere, acciò che lo vapore 36 mei si stingueva mentre ch’era solo:
37 tale scendeva l’etternale ardore; 38 onde la rena s’accendea, com’ esca 39 sotto focile, a doppiar lo dolore.
query.result:
**English:**
31 Like Alexander in those hot regions 32 of India saw above his army 33 flames falling steadily to the ground,
34 so he ordered his troops to stamp on the ground, 35 so that the vapor would be extinguished while it was still alone:
37 in such a way the eternal fire was descending; 38 so the sand was ignited, like tinder 39 under a flint, doubling the pain.
**Cornish:**
31 Kepar Aleksander ynwedn hyn rannvroow tomm 32 yn Eynda a welas war-barth y gerlys 33 flamys ow fethens dhe-ves dhe'n dor.
34 Rag wosa ev a leveris y werin 35 dhe'n stampya an dor, rag an ayr a via 36 ow tynnergh pub onan pan o ev a-huni.
37 Ynwedn hyn an tannow an tannow a-dheuth 38 ha'n dowr a via ow tannvos kepar losow 39 a-woles war-barth tanow, ow dowbla an poen.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
40 Sanza riposo mai era la tresca 41 de le misere mani, or quindi or quinci 42 escotendo da sé l’arsura fresca.
query.result:
**English:**
40 Without rest, the wretched hands 41 were always shaking off the fresh burning, 42 now here, now there.
**Cornish:**
40 Heb posegyans, an tres o'n dhewynnow 41 a'n dhewynnow truan, ow tos ha'n dre 42 ow skwya an gwresow nowydh a-woles.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
43 I’ cominciai: «Maestro, tu che vinci 44 tutte le cose, fuor che ’ demon duri 45 ch’a l’intrar de la porta incontra uscinci,
46 chi è quel grande che non par che curi 47 lo ’ncendio e giace dispettoso e torto, 48 sì che la pioggia non par che ’l marturi?».
query.result:
**English:**
43 I began: "Master, you who conquer 44 all things, except for those stubborn demons 45 who came out to meet us at the entrance to the gate,
46 who is that great one who doesn't seem to care 47 about the fire and lies scornful and twisted, 48 so that the rain doesn't seem to bother him?"
**Cornish:**
43 Me a dhallathas: "Mestron, ty a wra 44 oll an traow, mes an demonyon kales 45 a dheuth dhe'n fordh dhe'n porth dhe'n hon wra.
46 Piu ha'n brassa onan na wra gweles 47 an tannow ha'n kov dhe-ves ha'n gamm, 48 marnas an glaw na wra gweles ev a-woles?"

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
49 E quel medesmo, che si fu accorto 50 ch’io domandava il mio duca di lui, 51 gridò: «Qual io fui vivo, tal son morto.
query.result:
**English:**
49 And that same one, who had noticed 50 that I was asking my guide about him, 51 shouted: "As I was in life, so I am in death.
**Cornish:**
49 Ha'n huni, ow tos ow komprehendya 50 ow kovyn vy an Arlodh a-droytho, 51 a leveris: "Kepar ow kov vy byw, vy marow."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
52 Se Giove stanchi ’l suo fabbro da cui 53 crucciato prese la folgore aguta 54 onde l’ultimo dì percosso fui;
55 o s’elli stanchi li altri a muta a muta 56 in Mongibello a la focina negra, 57 chiamando “Buon Vulcano, aiuta, aiuta!”,
58 sì com’ el fece a la pugna di Flegra, 59 e me saetti con tutta sua forza: 60 non ne potrebbe aver vendetta allegra».
query.result:
**English:**
52 If Jove tires his blacksmith from whom, 53 in anger, he took the sharp thunderbolt 54 with which I was struck on my last day;
55 or if he tires the others, in turn, 56 at the black forge in Mount Etna, 57 calling "Good Vulcan, help, help!",
58 just as he did at the battle of Phlegra, 59 and he shot me with all his strength: 60 he could not have a joyful revenge.
**Cornish:**
52 Mar Joab a wra blonek y'n kov herwydh 53 ow kemer an folgor owth dhe-ves, 54 owth ow kov vy daras dhe'n jorna diwettha.
55 Mar ev a wra blonek an re erel 56 yn Mongibello dhe'n kov herwydh du, 57 ow leverel "Vulcan da, sywjel, sywjel!",
58 Kepar hag ev a wrug yn Flegra, 59 owth ow kov vy gans y oll y nerth: 60 na wra ev gallos an venjans owth a wra.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
61 Allora il duca mio parlò di forza 62 tanto, ch’i’ non l’avea sì forte udito: 63 «O Capaneo, in ciò che non s’ammorza
64 la tua superbia, se’ tu più punito; 65 nullo martiro, fuor che la tua rabbia, 66 sarebbe al tuo furor dolor compito».
query.result:
**English:**
61 Then my leader spoke with such force 62 that I had never heard him so loud: 63 "O Capaneus, in that your pride is not quenched, 64 you are punished all the more; 65 no torment, other than your own rage, 66 would be sufficient pain for your fury."
**Cornish:**
61 Anwedhen an dywghugh eth pysa yn kreff 62 kemmys, na'm ke'th klevys vythkweth dhe'n: 63 "O Capaneo, yn henna na wra dhe'n marow 64 dha ourgor, ty a vydh koshes moy; 65 neb marter, mes dha own furor, 66 a vydh dhe' dha furor dolour kompys."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
67 Poi si rivolse a me con miglior labbia, 68 dicendo: «Quei fu l’un d’i sette regi 69 ch’assiser Tebe; ed ebbe e par ch’elli abbia
70 Dio in disdegno, e poco par che ’l pregi; 71 ma, com’ io dissi lui, li suoi dispetti 72 sono al suo petto assai debiti fregi.
query.result:
**English:**
67 Then he turned to me with a gentler expression, 68 saying: "That was one of the seven kings 69 who besieged Thebes; and he had and it seems he still has
70 God in disdain, and he seems to care little for Him; 71 but, as I told him, his acts of contempt 72 are to his breast quite appropriate adornments.
**Cornish:**
67 Wosa henna ev drehevys dha'm gans lavara gwell, 68 ow leverel: "Henna o onan a'n seyth myghtern 69 a omsettyas Thebai; hag ev dheuth ha par dell yw ev
70 Dew yn anwonvos, ha byghan par dell yw ev a wravyth ev; 71 mes, dell yw me a leveris dhetho, y dhiwortha 72 yw dhe'n y vronna gans leun a vrederow teg.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
73 Or mi vien dietro, e guarda che non metti, 74 ancor, li piedi ne la rena arsiccia; 75 ma sempre al bosco tien li piedi stretti».
query.result:
**English:**
73 Now come behind me, and take care not to put 74 your feet in the burning sand; 75 but keep your feet always close to the wood."
**Cornish:**
73 Wosa vyth, ha gwel na wra tus, 74 an treys dhe'n avon tan, 75 mes dhe'n koed gwith an treys dhe'n glus."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
76 Tacendo divenimmo là ’ve spiccia 77 fuor de la selva un picciol fiumicello, 78 lo cui rossore ancor mi raccapriccia.
query.result:
**English:**
76 In silence we came to where a little stream 77 gushes forth from the forest, 78 whose redness still makes me shudder.
**Cornish:**
76 Yn taws, deuthon dhe'n le, le mayth 77 avon byghan a-dhyworth an koedh, 78 hag y rudhder a wra'm ow th'aga.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
79 Quale del Bulicame esce ruscello 80 che parton poi tra lor le peccatrici, 81 tal per la rena giù sen giva quello.
query.result:
**English:**
79 Like a stream that flows from the Bulicame, 80 which the sinners then divide among themselves, 81 so did that one go down through the sand.
**Cornish:**
79 Kepar avon a dheuth dhyworth an Bulicame, 80 a wra perthys lemmyn an pechatowrys, 81 kepar henna a'n jeva a-hedh dhyworth an avon.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
82 Lo fondo suo e ambo le pendici 83 fatt’ era ’n pietra, e ’ margini dallato; 84 per ch’io m’accorsi che ’l passo era lici.
query.result:
**English:**
82 Its bottom and both of its slopes 83 were made of stone, and the edges on the sides; 84 because of which I realized that the passage was narrow.
**Cornish:**
82 Y gledh ha'y dewleudhyow oll 83 o wrug gans prenn, ha'y orleuvow war-lergh; 84 rag wosa henna m'asswonvos bos an fordh cul.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
85 «Tra tutto l’altro ch’i’ t’ho dimostrato, 86 poscia che noi intrammo per la porta 87 lo cui sogliare a nessuno è negato,
88 cosa non fu da li tuoi occhi scorta 89 notabile com’ è ’l presente rio, 90 che sovra sé tutte fiammelle ammorta».
query.result:
**English:**
85 “Of all the other things that I have shown you, 86 after we entered through the gate 87 whose threshold is denied to no one,
88 what thing was not noticed by your eyes 89 as remarkable as the present stream, 90 which quenches all flames above it”?
**Cornish:**
85 “A-ugh an tra vose oll ow t’am dhiskwedhes, 86 wosa ni a-dhybri a-dreus an fordh 87 nag eus fordh dhelergh dhegys dhe dhynnar,
88 pyth voth na veu gwelys gans dha lyga 89 kepar an avon ma, 90 hag a wra pub an flammys war’n-onn”?

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
91 Queste parole fuor del duca mio; 92 per ch’io ’l pregai che mi largisse ’l pasto 93 di cui largito m’avëa il disio.
query.result:
**English:**
91 These words came from my leader; 92 because of which I begged him to grant me the food 93 for which he had given me the desire.
**Cornish:**
91 An gerow ma a veu leverys gans an dygh, 92 rag wosa henna y’m pythvos dhe dhysplegya an boes 93 a veu leverys gans an dygh an gows.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
94 «In mezzo mar siede un paese guasto», 95 diss’ elli allora, «che s’appella Creta, 96 sotto ’l cui rege fu già ’l mondo casto.
query.result:
**English:**
94 "In the middle of the sea sits a ruined land," 95 he said then, "which is called Crete, 96 under whose king the world was once pure.
**Cornish:**
94 "Y'n kres an mor yma bys trevesys," 95 leveris ef ena, "henwysys Kreta, 96 danvon an myghtern na veu an bys pudh."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
97 Una montagna v’è che già fu lieta 98 d’acqua e di fronde, che si chiamò Ida; 99 or è diserta come cosa vieta.
query.result:
**English:**
97 There is a mountain that once was joyful 98 with water and leaves, which was called Ida; 99 now it is deserted like something old and worn out.
**Cornish:**
97 Menydh onan eus nessa gwyn 98 gans dowr ha delyow, henwys o Ida; 99 mes a-lemmyn hi avel marow.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
100 Rëa la scelse già per cuna fida 101 del suo figliuolo, e per celarlo meglio, 102 quando piangea, vi facea far le grida.
query.result:
**English:**
100 Rhea chose it as a safe cradle 101 for her son, and to better conceal him, 102 when he cried, she made them make a loud noise.
**Cornish:**
100 Rëa a'y dewsyas avel rag fidys 101 rag y flogh, ha'gas gwella y gelwel, 102 pan oedh ow wewla, hi a wra gwruthyl an gri.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
103 Dentro dal monte sta dritto un gran veglio, 104 che tien volte le spalle inver’ Dammiata 105 e Roma guarda come süo speglio.
query.result:
**English:**
103 Inside the mountain stands a great old man, 104 who turns his back to Damietta ten times 105 and looks at Rome as his mirror.**Cornish:**
103 Mes an menydh yma sevel onan koth, 104 hag degweyth ydro dhe'n Damyata 105 ha gwel Roma avel y voylys.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
112 Ciascuna parte, fuor che l’oro, è rotta 113 d’una fessura che lagrime goccia, 114 le quali, accolte, fóran quella grotta.
query.result:
**English:**
112 Every part, except the gold, is broken 113 by a fissure that drips tears, 114 which, when collected, form that cave.**Cornish:**
112 Pub tra an rann, mes an our, yma torrys 113 gans onan fendor a wra dhegor dowr, 114 hag anedha, pan vossynsys, a wra gwres an ogof henna.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
115 Lor corso in questa valle si diroccia; 116 fanno Acheronte, Stige e Flegetonta; 117 poi sen van giù per questa stretta doccia,
118 infin, là ove più non si dismonta, 119 fanno Cocito; e qual sia quello stagno 120 tu lo vedrai, però qui non si conta».

Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
121 E io a lui: «Se ’l presente rigagno 122 si diriva così dal nostro mondo, 123 perché ci appar pur a questo vivagno?».
query.result:
**English:**
121 And I said to him: "If this present stream 122 flows down from our world, 123 why does it only appear to us at this edge?".**Cornish:**
121 Ha my a-dhi: "Mar an avon henna 122 a wra redya a-dhia dhyworth y'n bys, 123 peraga'th yw gwelys dhyn ni mes war an kethva henna?".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
124 Ed elli a me: «Tu sai che ’l loco è tondo; 125 e tutto che tu sie venuto molto, 126 pur a sinistra, giù calando al fondo,
127 non se’ ancor per tutto ’l cerchio vòlto; 128 per che, se cosa n’apparisce nova, 129 non de’ addur maraviglia al tuo volto».

Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
130 E io ancor: «Maestro, ove si trova 131 Flegetonta e Letè? ché de l’un taci, 132 e l’altro di’ che si fa d’esta piova».
query.result:
**English:**
130 And I again: "Master, where is 131 Phlegethon and Lethe? for of the one you are silent, 132 and of the other you say that it is made of this rain."
**Cornish:**
130 Ha my avel: "Mester, plega'th yma 131 Flegetonta ha Letè? rag unn a wra vyth, 132 ha'n aral a wra y feuur a'n glav ma."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
133 «In tutte tue question certo mi piaci», 134 rispuose, «ma ’l bollor de l’acqua rossa 135 dovea ben solver l’una che tu faci.
query.result:
**English:**
133 "In all your questions you certainly please me," 134 he replied, "but the boiling of the red water 135 should have solved the one that you are asking.
**Cornish:**
133 "Yn oll dha govyn sur vyth owth car, 134 a leveris, "mes an fordh a'n dowr rudh 135 a dhalleth daffar an unn a wra vyth.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
136 Letè vedrai, ma fuor di questa fossa, 137 là dove vanno l’anime a lavarsi 138 quando la colpa pentuta è rimossa».
query.result:
**English:**
136 You will see Lethe, but outside of this ditch, 137 there where the souls go to wash themselves 138 when the repented fault is removed.
**Cornish:**
136 Letè a welow, mes a-ves a'n foss ma, 137 le mayth an eneow an enevalow 138 pan vo an pechodh penedhys a dhefens.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
139 Poi disse: «Omai è tempo da scostarsi 140 dal bosco; fa che di retro a me vegne: 141 li margini fan via, che non son arsi,
142 e sopra loro ogne vapor si spegne».
query.result:
**English:**
139 Then he said: "Now it is time to depart 140 from the wood; see that you come behind me: 141 the banks make a path, which are not burned,
142 and above them every vapor is extinguished."
**Cornish:**
139 Wosa leveris: "Wosa prys dhe dhyskynna 140 a'n koedh; gwre aga dhe'm dhe dhyski: 141 an gwernow a wra fordh, na'ns yw loskys,
142 ha wartha aga pub an avor a dhef."
